Package cellularAutomata.rules

Class Summary
ALifePi Uses a genetic algorithm to solve for Pi.
AlternateContinuousCA Takes the average of the neighbors, plugs into the linear equation "slope * avg + yInterecept", and then keeps only the fractional part.
BriansBrain Brian's Brain rule (discovered/popularized by Brian Silverman).
Bunnies This surprising CA uses many states to create a bunny rabbit shape.
ChainLinkFence From a single initial sead, his rule will build a square lattice.
ChutesLaddersAndShifts A rule which produces chutes, ladders, ray guns, and a wide variety of other behaviors depending on the number of states.
CollidingCyclones Create a cyclic CA rule with spirals, inspired/discovered by David Griffeath.
ComplexContinuousCA Takes the average of the cell and its neighbors, plugs into the linear equation "slope * avg + yInterecept", and then keeps only the fractional part.
ComplexLife Creates a Life-like simulation.
ComplexSortTwoDim Sorts complex numbers in two-dimensional space.
ContinuousCA Takes the average of the cell and its neighbors, plugs into the linear equation "slope * avg + yInterecept", and then keeps only the fractional part.
CoolClassIV Creates a class IV CA with 3 states corresponding to totalistic rule number 1329.
CopyRandomNeighbor Copies the value of a random neighbor.
CrystalLife Outer totalistic rule 435 with a running average of 2.
CyclicCA Create a cyclic CA, inspired/discovered by David Griffeath.
CyclicPulse Cells always increase in value, but they increase by double the normal amount if surrounded by 4 or more neighbors with larger values.
Diffusion Rules for diffusion which obey the heat equation dp/dt = del^2 p.
DiffusionLimitedAggregation Rule for diffusion limited aggregation.
DrunkGliders A rule on a hexagonal lattice which produces stunning, drunk gliders.
ElectricLoops Outer totalistic rule 301 with a running average of 2.
EpilepticBlobs Outer totalistic rule 429.
Fireworks A fun rule that looks like fireworks when started from a single seed.
ForestFire Rule that mimics a forest fire.
Fractal A rule which assigns complex numbers to each cell and then displays them as Mandelbrot and Julia sets.
FractalIteration A rule which assigns complex numbers to each cell and then displays them as Mandelbrot and Julia sets.
FractalThreshold A rule which assigns complex numbers to each cell; if the modulus of "the sum of the neighbors minus the cell" is less than a threshold, then the cell is multiplied by 1-i.
GalacticFlashWeb Cells always increase in value, but they increase by double the normal amount if surrounded by 6 or more neighbors with larger values.
GrowingSeed If any neighbor is occupied, then the cell becomes occupied with state 1.
HexLife Same as the class Life, but with hexagonal graphics.
House This surprising CA uses many states to create a house shape.
IntegerAverage Averages the cell and it's neighbors and returns the nearest integer.
IntegerRule A base class for all integer-based rules (not vectors of integers, just single integers).
IntegerSort Sorts integer numbers on a one-dimensional line.
IsingModel The classic two-state Ising Model from physics.
Julia A rule which uses a complex number for each cell.
Lambda Randomly generates a rule with the given value of lambda (provided through an "additional properties panel").
LatticeGas Rules for a hexagonal lattice gas automaton following the basic FHP approach.
LavaLamp Create a cyclic CA, inspired/discovered by Jason Rampe.
Life Rules for the game of life.
Lightning Creates a class III CA with interweaving class IV? Looks like lightning! From rule number 6055785317397.
MajorityProbablyWins Rule for joining factions based on the percent present.
MajorityWins Rule for the majority winning.
MajorityWinsWithRealValues Cells take the closer value of two randomly selected neighbors.
MajorityWinsWithSelf Rule for the majority winning.
MajorityWinsWithSelfAndReals Cells becomes the median value of themselves and their neighbors.
MinorityWins Rule for the minority winning.
MinorityWinsWithSelf Rule for the minority winning.
MovingFractal A lattice-gas-style rule with vectors of complex numbers.
NeuralNet A rule that treats each cell as a neuron.
Nucleation Create a cyclic CA, inspired/discovered by Jason Rampe.
ObesityModel Rule for becoming obese based on your neighbors obesity.
OuterTotalistic Creates an outer totalistic CA rule for a given lattice and rule "code".
PistonPrime Similar to Life but not as dynamic and ending in still life with occasional pistons.
PrettyClassIV Creates a class IV CA with 4 states corresponding to rule number 27645726470709879688601734854573817858 (as outlined by the numbering scheme in the RuleNumber class).
PrimeDeath Similar to Life, but most patterns create gliders.
PrimePlague Similar to Life but not as dynamic and ending in still life with occasional pistons.
PulsingSnowflake Similar to the Q2R Ising rule, but with three states.
Q2RIsingModel A deterministic version of the Ising Model from physics.
RandomUpdate Randomly chooses a new state for the cell, independent of the neighbors.
RealSort Sorts real numbers on a one-dimensional line.
RealSpirals Cells always increase in value, but they increase by double the normal amount if surrounded by 2 or more neighbors with larger values.
ReversibleRuleNumber Same as WolframRuleNumber but XORs the answer with the cell's state from the previous generation as well.
RockPaperScissorsRule Rule that plays the game rock-paper-scissors.
Rule A function that changes a cell's state based on the states of neighboring cells.
Rule110 The two-state CA rule 110, numbered according to Wolfram's numbering scheme.
Rule30 The two-state CA rule 30, numbered according to Wolfram's numbering scheme.
RuleActions This encompasses actions that a Rule might need, like forcing a refresh of the graphics, pausing the CA, etc.
RuleNumber Creates an integer-based rule from a rule number specified by the user.
SatansStaircase Creates a three-dimensional staircase out of triangles.
SelfishCA The neighbors are used to determine what rule is applied to each cell.
Snowflake Outer totalistic rule 846.
SnowflakeDust Outer totalistic rule 68.
SnowflakeMaze Outer totalistic rule 750.
Spirals On a square (8 neighbor) lattice, this rule produces spirals that never stop unwinding.
SumModuloN A rule which calculates the sum modulo N of the neighbors.
SuperLoops Outer totalistic rule 429 with a running average of 2.
Symmetry A sample rule illustrating symmetries.
ThunderStorm Takes the average of the cell and neighbors, adds a small periodic amount, and modulos by the maximum value.
Totalistic Creates a totalistic CA rule for a given lattice and rule "code".
TriLife Same as the class Life, but with triangular graphics.
TunnellingSpaceships A rule which produces spaceship-like lines, and a wide variety of other behaviors depending on the number of states and the lattice.
WaterSkimmers Takes the average of the cell and neighbors, adds a small random amount, and modulos by the maximum value.
WolframRuleNumber Binary rules apply to linear one-dimensional CA.
